alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 6:38PM EDT until July 21 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Aroostook County in northern Maine... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 638 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fish River Lake, or 10 miles southeast of Deboullie Mountain, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Eagle Lake, Woodland, Portage Lake, New Canada, Fish River Lake, Cross Lake, Perham, Wade, Winterville and Westmanland. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A severe thunderstorm has some potential for producing a tornado although forecaster confidence is not high enough to issue a tornado warning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
